intro: Barbosella handroi, commonly known as the Handroi's barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Barbosella handroi is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat, thriving in well-drained soils and partial shade.
